main: ^Folks are saying that you're leaving again. Is that right?
^It is. This might be the last time, at least. One way or another.
^That's why I wanted to stop you. If I can do anything at all, I would like to. I'm in your debt.
^Alright. I'd ask for your perspective, then.
^There was so much in the mines that I was not prepared for.
^Dozens of monsters. Alien things sprouting from the earth. I thought it could not get worse than in town, but...
^Hell on earth, it seems to me. I never thought I'd see the day.
^That so many people could be swayed by that manner of thing wounds my soul.
^I don't think this is Hell, bishop.
^These people were not devil worshipers. I feel that even they did not know what they called upon.
^The way those monsters act, they are like animals. Chaotic, following instinct.
^Animals are of nature, of God. Those abominations most certainly are not, Maria.
^Maybe not. But they live to fight. To spread. It is like...
^Thank you for your words, bishop. I must be going.
^I need to find the root before it continues to grow.
